arma

Class RunningStatVec

  • java.lang.Object
    • arma.RunningStatVec

  • public class RunningStatVec
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides statistical measures for large observations where the individual observations cannot be stored completely or are not relevant. Besides the covariance, each measurement is performed per dimension.
    Author:
    Sebastian Niemann

    • Constructor Detail

      • RunningStatVec

        public RunningStatVec(boolean calculateCovariance)
        Initialises the statistical measures.

        Set calculateCovariance to true if the covariance should be calculated.

        Parameters:
        calculateCovariance - Whether to calculate the covariance.

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update(Mat samples)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Recalculates the statistical measures with the provided values.

        Non-canonical: An IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown if the size of the provided samples did not match previous observations. Use reset() to reuse this instance for new sample sizes.

        Parameters:
        samples - The provided values.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Non-canonical: Thrown if the size of the provided samples did not match previous observations. Use {code reset()} to reuse this instance for new sample sizes.

      • count

        public double count()
        Returns the amount of observed samples.
        Returns:
        The amount.

        Returns the smallest observed value per dimension.
        Returns:

        public Mat max()
        Returns the largest observed value per dimension.
        Returns:

      • mean

        public Mat mean()
        Returns the mean of all observed samples per dimension.
        Returns:
        The mean.

      • var

        public Mat var()
        Returns the variance of all observed samples per dimension with normalisation by count() - 1.

        Non-canonical: An IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown if the normalisation type is not one of 0 or 1.

        Returns:
        The variance.

      • var

        public Mat var(int normType)
        Returns the variance of all observed samples per dimension.

        Performs either normalisation by count() - 1 if normType = 0 or by count().

        Non-canonical: An IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown if the normalisation type is not one of 0 or 1.

        Parameters:
        normType - The normalisation to be used.
        Returns:
        The variance.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the normalisation type is not one of 0 or 1.

      • stddev

        public Mat stddev()
        Returns the standard deviation of all observed samples per dimension with normalisation by count() - 1.

        Non-canonical: An IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown if the normalisation type is not one of 0 or 1.

        Returns:
        The standard deviation.

      • stddev

        public Mat stddev(int normType)
        Returns the standard deviation of all observed samples per dimension.

        Performs either normalisation by count() - 1 if normType = 0 or by count().

        Non-canonical: An IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown if the normalisation type is not one of 0 or 1.

        Parameters:
        normType - The normalisation to be used.
        Returns:
        The standard deviation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the normalisation type is not one of 0 or 1.

      • cov

        public Mat cov()
        throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Returns the covariance of all observed samples per dimension with normalisation by count() - 1.

        Non-canonical: An IllegalAccessException exception is thrown if the calculation of the covariance was not initial requested.

        Returns:
        The covariance.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - Thrown if the calculation of the covariance was not initial requested.

      • cov

        public Mat cov(int normType)
        throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
               java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the covariance of all observed samples per dimension.

        Performs either normalisation by count() - 1 if normType = 0 or by count().

        Non-canonical:

        • An IllegalAccessException exception is thrown if the calculation of the covariance was not initial requested.
        • An IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown if the normalisation type is not one of 0 or 1.
        Parameters:
        normType - The normalisation to be used.
        Returns:
        The covariance.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - Thrown if the calculation of the covariance was not initial requested.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the normalisation type is not one of 0 or 1.

        Resets the observation.
